isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-6613 SERIES - INSTALL - AUXILIARY REAR HOUSING

note.para: Make sure that prior to installation the synchronizer assembly is as far forward as possible on the output shaft and that the marked teeth on the auxiliary countershafts are facing each other.

step1.para: Using a hoist, move the rear housing up to the intermediate housing and start the rear housing into position with the top tipped back slightly to allow the synchronizer assembly to pass between the auxiliary countershafts ( Figure 261). Check the synchronizer occasionally to make sure that the direct synchronizer is not sliding off the low speed blocker pins. Look through the rear bearing bores and mesh the marked tooth on each countershaft between the two marked teeth on each side of the auxiliary low speed gear. Move the rear housing evenly onto the two dowel pins, using caution to prevent damage to the oil trough.

figure.caption: Figure 260. Start Rear Housing into Position

step1.para: Secure the rear housing with the retaining bolts ( Figure 262). Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 261. Secure Rear Housing With Retaining Bolts

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul against the rear of both auxiliary countershafts to seat the front bearings and use a bearing driver to install the rear bearings on the shafts and in the bores ( Figure 263).

figure.caption: Figure 262. Seat Front Bearings and Install Rear Bearings

step1.para: Install the rear bearing retaining snap rings in the countershaft grooves ( Figure 264).

figure.caption: Figure 263. Install Rear Bearing Retaining Snap Rings

step1.para: Install the rear bearing covers ( Figure 265). Tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N·m).
Install the gasket on the intermediate shift shaft ( ).

figure.caption: Figure 265. Install Gasket on Intermediate Shift Shaft

step1.para: Install the O-ring in the shift cylinder. Install the intermediate shift cylinder in the rear housing, fitting the shift shaft through the cylinder bore ( Figure 267). Cylinder is installed with the small air channel in the housing to the right.

figure.caption: Figure 266. Install Intermediate Shift Cylinder in Rear Housing

step1.para: Install the O-ring on the outer diameter of the piston and install the piston on the shaft in the cylinder ( Figure 268). Lubricate O-ring with silicone.

figure.caption: Figure 267. Install O-Ring on Outer Diameter of Piston

step1.para: Install the elastic stop nut on the shift shaft ( Figure 269). Tighten to 35 to 40 ft-lbs. (47 to 54 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 268. Install Elastic Stop Nut on Shift Shaft

step1.para: Install the shift cylinder cover, aligning the small air channel on the cover with the hole in the gasket and the channel in the housing ( Figure 270). The insert valve opening on the cover will be facing down. Tighten to 20 to 25 ft-lbs. (27 to 34 N·m).
Install the insert valve in the cover with the flat end facing up ( Figure 271).

figure.caption: Figure 270. Install Insert Valve in Cover

step1.para: Install the insert valve nut in the cover ( Figure 272). Tighten to 40 to 50 ft-lbs. (54 to 68 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 271. Install Insert Valve Nut in Cover
